p: Antimicrobials were prescribed in 89.5% (247/276) of the dogs with acute diarrhea. Classes used were nitroimidazoles (72.1%), potentiated aminopenicillins (29.1%), fluoroquinolones (7.6%), NP‐aminopenicillins (3.6%), tetracyclines (1%) and third‐generation cephalosporins (1%). Antimicrobial therapy was significantly associated with the presence of bloody diarrhea ( P < 0.001). It complied in 43.5% (120/276; JS‐1) with current guidelines restricting therapy to the use of aminopenicillins in suspected sepsis.
